artist: Tom Hammick; Printer: Tom Hammick; Publisher: Hammick Editions, East Sussex, England
creditline: The John E. Andrus III Endowment Fund
provenance: Hammick Editions, East Sussex, England; (Flowers Gallery, New York); sold to MIA, 2016
signed: In pencil, LRC: Tank EV 5/12 Tom Hammick
text: In Tom Hammick’s unique woodcut Tank, a solitary figure observed from behind stands before an industrial storage tank beneath a star-filled night sky. The print’s limited palette and simplified formal arrangement typify Hammick’s minimalist approach, one in which the dreamlike landscape serves as the setting for a metaphorical consideration of the human condition. The lone figure is a symbolic stand-in for human experience. We observe from a distance while the man peers at the night landscape, as if in silent dialogue with his surroundings. Like a poem or a piece of music, Hammick’s abstracted landscape possesses a deep emotional resonance that is at once familiar and mysterious
title: Tank
